website_summaries.verdict: Stylish, unbreakable driving, fishing, and outdoor sport lenses that are priced well.
pros: The clip-on mechanism is easy to operate and low profile
Comes with a nylon draw-string pouch and a huge polishing cloth
Good-quality and smart-looking for those who want something with a little fashion sense
cons: Hinge is so large that it will not allow some glasses to fit properly
Some might find the fit to be uncomfortable

customer_reviews.title: Those are good enough to look at weeds
customer_reviews.text: I needed two pairs of clip-on sunglasses and bought this one as well asBoth are well built and have similar technical specs. However, I can see a lot more clearly with the Besgoods clipped onto my prescription glasses than I can with the ElementsActive pair. So, those Besgoods get used for driving and the ElementsActive get used for yard work. Those are good enough to look at weeds. This is an excellent alternative to prescription sunglasses. I have a pair and was considering getting new lenses with my latest prescription. The tinting is nicer and the combination has the same sharpness. These are wider than any of my prescription glasses and therefore provide better protection.
customer_reviews.author: James Lande

customer_reviews.title: Good, Fast, Cheap! Now you can choose all three!
customer_reviews.text: These are as Dark as the higher priced Premium Lightweight Flip up/ Clip-ons but are 50% cheaper. They have a metal clip, and Silver rivets through the lens. Properly polarized, they will block your view of a laptop screen, or your iphone. They are a good deal darker than my previous clip ons, and they flip up, and are easy to put on one handed. They are a lot more convenient, freeing up a hand to hold my cane, very nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: The right sunglass solution
customer_reviews.text: Update: While the clip-on mechanically is great, the coatings wiped off when I cleaned them. I used the same Zeiss lens wipes I use on my glasses and other fine optics. Maybe this is an anomaly and for the price, I suppose I can't be too disappointed. I've tried several other clip-on sunglasses with differing levels of satisfaction striving to find the "right" version. I believe I found them, these sunglasses are stable and do a great job of protecting and enhancing my vision.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit, terrible vision
customer_reviews.text: The hinge is so large that it will not allow my glasses to fit properly. Very uncomfortable fit. Mounting these sunglasses throws off the alignment of the glasses and makes my progressive lenses useless. The lenses are not clear vision, there is reflection between my lens and the clip ons. Return through Prime very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Psoup

customer_reviews.title: Very generic size and fit
customer_reviews.text: I needed a set of clip-ons for hiking and didnt have time nor desire to buy prescription transition lenses. These were very basic, didnt fully cover my glasses as hoped (I tried to order the best size for my frames), and eventually I didnt use them at all. I ended up buying a set of clip ons that bracket my frames and as opposed to flipping up, and they were better for my needs. While I am sure they would be suitable for most simple needs, they didnt meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Clip mechanism far easier to use than other types I've used.
customer_reviews.text: These clip-on sunglasses go a good job of blocking the sun's rays. Compared to the previous pair I'd used, they go on far more easily with the spring-loaded clips. This is a tremendous advantage, for I consider it very important for clip-on sunglasses to be able to go on easily. If they don't, then they're useless. These are far from useless. The mechanism feels robust, but as I've had them for less than a week at the time of writing this review, only time will tell as to how robust they will be.
customer_reviews.author: Roger W. Reini

customer_reviews.title: Good quality clip-on, flip-up sunglasses at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: I like these clip-on, flip-up sunglasses and they work well. I use these for driving in my car on sunny days as I wear prescription glasses but often need to also look at something inside the car like the GPS. The metal hinge on these glasses seems robust and the clip is easy enough to safely put on my glasses one-handed while I'm driving. Rubber boots protect my prescription glasses. The sunglasses are a standard neutral gray and are dark enough to do the job well without being too dark. I like the fact these are polarized lenses. I'm pleased with my purchase and recommend these sunglasses if they are the proper size and shape for your glasses as well.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Field

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of blue a set of yellow for night and fog. I love them. Came quickly. Fit my glasses okay, and were scratch free, and chrystal clear. I really like them. They are very handy for me to just flip up when I go in a store etc instead of taking off my prescription sunglasses and putting on my clear glasses. Several strangers have told me I looked cool when I flipped them up nonchalantly. Okay, that's a lie. But I bet they thought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jhimi Island

customer_reviews.title: They may sit better on a different set of prescription frames
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them much. The mechanism at the top sits so far back that it touches my forehead and pushes the bridge down my nose. Also, when trying to flip them up with one hand, the mechanism is so tight that it pulls them off the glasses. It's OK with two hands but this isn't possible when driving into a dark parking garage. They may sit better on a different set of prescription frames, and one advantage over the other kind of clip-ons I've used, with hooks at the side, is they don't catch when taking them out of a shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace the ones I had which had broken and very expensive. Found these to be reasonably priced. When they arrived I was anxious to see if they fit my glasses as well as a spare. They were a perfect fit and better than the ones I originally had...the tint on these did a much better job of omitting the suns glare. As a Prime member I am so happy to have received them within days of putting in the order!
customer_reviews.author: mary P.

customer_reviews.title: I really like these glasses and they ARE unbreakable!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these glasses. I bought them because they said they were unbreakable. I didn't believe that, but thought, ok, they may be close to unbreakable. So far, they seem pretty good and they fit well on my prescription glasses and fit well into my glasses case. I like them a lot. UPDATE: THESE SUNGLASSES REALLY ARE UNBREAKABLE. I bought two in August 2017. As of October, 2018, after I have thrown them around and even washed them in the washing machine, they show NO wear at all..I am recording because I lost one of the two I ordered in August,2017. I don't want to be without them inn both my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE! Returns not accepted and they don't cover for the repored size
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE! dimensions where correct for my glasses but the clip does not allow the clip on to cover the glass as shown in the photos.. They do not accept returns.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Bad clips.  Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, the clips do not open wide enough and they are located where they hit the nose pads of my glasses. I bent the clips a little with needle nose pliers, but that required a lot of force and they gave only a little.
customer_reviews.author: TexasTen

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: The polarization was there, but minimal, would have liked more, but quality in line with price. The glasses look decent, and function as stated. They are not heavy duty, but that was not expected with this price point.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Sawning

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon description for this item claims UV400 Protection, however, I received no sticker or notice of authenticity about that along with the product. They clip on and fit my glasses just fine, and it doesn't harm my glasses, but... this item weighs down the glasses, making it uncomfortable to wear, and the clip prevents me from scooting the glasses close to my face as I normally wear them. For these reasons, I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Customer T

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sunglasses to Leave In Car
customer_reviews.text: These work very well clipped over my plain glasses. I have prescription sunglasses that I often forget to grab when going somewhere in the car. I leave these clip-on glasses in the car and they work just as well. The polarization is very effective especially when getting glare on the windshield. I have had them for about 10 months now and they are still in good shape. They may look geeky if I flip them up if I go in somewhere, but they give good eye protection and clear vision which is what counts. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SCL

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Bad design, sits 5mm from actual prescription lenses. Also can not sit close enough to face due to top clip hitting face before glasses are all the way up nose.
customer_reviews.author: Official Reviews

customer_reviews.title: work great for driving when you have photo sensitive lenses
customer_reviews.text: I keep several of these lying around in various places, they are quite handy. My only complaint is that the little rubber tips sometimes fall off which can cause scratches on your lenses. They should glue the rubber tips on.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel V. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Clip Part Broke
customer_reviews.text: The clip part broke and the return period was only one month. I guess that's about as long as they expected it to last. I wouldn't recommend these because they are not durable and not returnable after a month. I would really like a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great Sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: The clip on to my glasses and fit perfectly, held firmly in place bu a good quality clip and rubber-like plastic ends so your lens dont get scratched. I find these to be good for use in my current location (Afghanistan) as I dont have to carry extra shades and can flip up/down as needed. Plus the polarized lens really knocks the glare down.
customer_reviews.author: G M Knotts

customer_reviews.title: If you need clip-ons, these are great.
customer_reviews.text: These are really great clip-ons. I gave 4 stars rather than 5, because I would prefer a couple more mm on height, i.e., they don't sell a size large enough to actually fit my glasses. My last clip-ons died because I accidentally put them in my shirt pocket with a cell phone. After an hour of rubbing together, the lens was ruined. These clip-ons come with a bag to put them in, which I have kept and I use it. I don't expect any more ruined lenses because of other things in my shirt pocket. The rubber grippers are much better than the usual ones that I see. These should save my glasses from abrasion.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Slattery

customer_reviews.title: Great clip-ons for the price. Look nice, work very well, easy to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: Great clip-ons. Fit my traditional square Ray-Bans style frames perfectly. Easy to put on and take off, easy to flip up and down. Not obvious that they're not part of the glasses unless you look carefully. Good amount of tinting plus the polarization make them great for driving. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Review update. I have downgraded my opinion of these ...
customer_reviews.text: Review update. I have downgraded my opinion of these clip-ons. After wearing them in some bright sunlight, I noticed that I get a reflection or glare from the clip-on that makes it very hard to see clearly. I was willing to put up with the distraction from the pieces that go down on the glasses, but now they are just unusable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Made in China- Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made . . . doesn't even cover normally sized glasses. Not a mirror finish as advertised. I avoid anything made in China but there was no way of knowing the country of origin . . . something that should be required on all product sold on line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The clip is quite uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The clip that holds the device in place over my prescription glasses presses on my forehead and is quite uncomfortable and the lenses do not lay down over my lenses well leaving a gap that is distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Erdmann

customer_reviews.title: Trade Off
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive. Fits nicely over my glasses. I like the fact that it works in the car. The negative is that every time I go out I forget to bring it and end up squinting. However, it's a whole lot cheaper than the lenses that darken in the sun. Addendum: Wore them outside for the first time and found there is a space between the clip-ons and my glasses allowing blinding sunlight at some angles. Other reviewers mentioned this. Decided to spend the money and get prescription sunglasses. Will use these in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Diana S. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: They clip on securely, flip up easily
customer_reviews.text: These clip-ons make your prescription glasses into prescription sunglasses easily. They offer practical eye protection. My daughter likes the ones I got for her, so she doesb't have to fumble with extra glasses while driving. I will pet some for myself after my next cataract removal, once I get glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Knight

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you're not a motorcyclist
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you're not a motorcyclist. The spring in the turning mechanism was extremely disappointing and is flimsy as all hell, doesn't wanna decide to work when you're going 50MPH, or even 90 down the highway while racing an Audi on a Honda Shadow 750.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: Now all I have to do to see well inside my vehicle is flip the sunglasses up and presto I see inside! Does an excellent job of blocking out the glare and excessive brightness. A great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SlowTram

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - they don't last
customer_reviews.text: The shading part worked well. But the little plastic ball that protects the lens from the sharp edge of the prongs that hold it on came off after a couple of weeks of light use. Made them useless - I'm not going to risk scratching my glasses! Contacted the seller, but no response, so had to pursue a refund from Amazon. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JLo

customer_reviews.title: Eyeglass clip on - be sure about the size you order
customer_reviews.text: I bought several pairs of eyeglass clip on online and learned from my mistake. As a product this clip on is sufficiently well made. But BEFORE shopping online for one that fits your eyeglass I suggest you first walk into a store and try it on. That is because eye wear comes in so many different shapes and sizes, and the slightest error in measurement will prove to be a costly mistake. One can easily purchase the wrong size online.
customer_reviews.author: Big Miles Davis Fan

customer_reviews.title: Visually these were very nice. They included a cloth carrying tote and a ...
customer_reviews.text: Visually these were very nice. They included a cloth carrying tote and a microfiber cleaning cloth. They fit over my prescription glasses mostly ok. The bridge where the clip release presses against my forehead forcing me to wear my glasses slightly lower on my nose, which is slightly uncomfortable. They don't add much extra weight. The flip up works well, although I never use it. They are polarized for sure, and that helps cut glare down quite a bit. I bought these as a temporary shade until my new prescription sunglasses arrive and for that purpose they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Buresh

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: They fit my glasses perfectly, flip up action is smooth and stays put, polarization works well and does a great job blocking glare. A lot of value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: FrankW

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best product for the money. I'm using these shades every day and I'm very happy with them. They clip on nicely, fit the glasses well, and are easy to flip up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Useful clip ons
customer_reviews.text: These clip ons are well made, robust, and easy to use. They make life a bit easier by not requiring you to have two or more separate eyeglasses available all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D Vanwyk

customer_reviews.title: Item is not returnable.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This item is not returnable due to being "a personal item" which I find absurd as it is only a clip-on that goes on one's glasses!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: These are the shit! No more buying prescription sunglasses!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I didn't think of buying clip ons before! Now I don't have to spent a ton of money on prescription sunglasses!! These are awesome! super lightweight. The clips that attach to the sunglasses have nice little rubber grips. My glasses are bigger than the clip on lens, but they work!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Not good! Too much hardware made it too heavy AND ...
customer_reviews.text: Not good! Too much hardware made it too heavy AND distracting all the hardware in the middle! Ended up buying a better pair at Walgreens!
customer_reviews.author: 110lbslost

customer_reviews.title: Good heads up display when needed.
customer_reviews.text: Should cost more, but I'm glad they don't. The spring-clip clamp-on feature is very functional for ease of use. The envelope size is perfect to cover my prescription frames. Why did I need these when I already have this feature in my glasses? Simple! My glasses don't dim enough while in the car. The only other option I had was to buy a prescription pair of sunglasses at $250.00. This is a great solution for a polarized clip on pair while saving over $240.00.
customer_reviews.author: Signetring54

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative to expensive prescription sunglasses.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these Besgoods clip-on, flip-up sunglasses. Compared them to my polarized non prescription sunglasses and these Besgoods clip-ons that I received are definitely polarized. Came with a bag to store them in and also a cleaning cloth. Nice alternative for me as I did not want to spend a fortune on prescription sunglasses that I will probably break.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: I chose these from many on Amazon because of the metal clip for durability to get them and find the clip fine but the lenses are sub-par
customer_reviews.text: Lenses are too thin and flimsy. I chose these from many on Amazon because of the metal clip for durability to get them and find the clip fine but the lenses are sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: Barton H. Kogan

customer_reviews.title: Well made; excellent fit.
customer_reviews.text: Although I was concerned about choosing the proper size for my glasses these fit as though they were made for them. The spring clips are sturdy rubber tipped metal not plastic so they should handle a lot of flip up and flip down action. A good sized micro-fiber cleaning cloth is included as well as a polarization test card. I would have gladly given this item 5 stars if a hard shell or plastic storage case were included instead of a cinch pouch. I am going to order a second one for the car and I would recommend this product if you have a similar prescription lens that matches its shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Shm

customer_reviews.title: Not your grandfathers clipons.
customer_reviews.text: Not your grandfather's clipons. These are well made, stout, metal ( not plastic) clip/flip mechanism, and the plastic is polarized in such a way that your iPhone or car display doesn't black out. Nicely made, but they are still clip/flip, which means there is a space between the filter and the lens which creates glare if the sun is shining down. In the car it's no problem, outside I have to wear a cap. I wish they made the same product with a clip only, no flip-up, to eliminate that glare problem
customer_reviews.author: Island Guy

customer_reviews.title: Clip-on sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three shades. They are well made with metal clips and good rubber tips. The polarized lens work well and fit my true rectangle glasses. The Brown ones shown here do well for daytime driving without being so dark as to obscure the instrument panel. The Royal Blue mirror finish, as noted in some other reviews, are nice and dark, best suited for bright outdoors. I'll be trying these out on my next fishing trip. The Yellow increase contrast making them perfect for night time driving and may work well in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus A

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great convenience.
customer_reviews.text: I like these glasses. Fit to my prescription lenses is good and the clip on feature is sturdy and easy to use on the run. Some clip on features are too tiny and require one to stop, take off one's prescription lenses and affix the clip on...not so with these. I would give it a higher score, however, I haven't had an opportunity to experience its durability as of yet. So far, for the price, I think that this is a great product. If you were to purchase a similar product from your eyeglass retail company, you could pay up to $60.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: These were a reasonably close fit and work quite well. I just remember polarized lenses I had in the past reducing glare a bit more. But, all in all these work well and the spring loaded clip has proven to be quite good. Most of those clips seem to break off within the first couple of clip and unclip cycles in previous clip on sunglasses I have tried. The spring clip on these has held up quite good and shows no signs of fatigue after a few weeks of use. They do the job and I would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bittle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect eye protection for all seasons!
customer_reviews.text: Received these yesterday, they are very well made and light weight, easy to connect and fit on my glasses perfectly. Today is a very bight, sunny, cold day with over 18 inches of fresh snow. These sun glasses are just what the doctor ordered, I was able to see perfectly in all directions even with the sun reflecting off the 'sharp white' of the snow, fantastic eye protection. I will be buying another pair just to keep in my car for those cloudy days that turn bright and sunny when least expected. These sunglasses will be great to have while day hiking in the warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent R. Kudirka

customer_reviews.title: Built well & work great!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I first saw these. I didn't think they would be effective. They are. I've bought the kind with the spring in the middle locally, and the spring didn't last. These however, have a very strong center piece, and they stay in place and look nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Raylene

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Clamp broke as soon as I tried to hook to my glasses. Went to return and they don’t accept returns. Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew's mom

customer_reviews.title: Great flip-up sunglasses!
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and fit my glasses perfectly. I like that they hold to the glasses frame tightly and don't shift when I flip them up. I also like that they actually sort of "lock" into position when you flip them up and down. I like the brown as it provides a softer look when driving. I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use these when I am working in my shop.
customer_reviews.text: Primarily used for using a small torch over safety glasses. Very convenient. I'm rough on glasses, so when I saw the quality of these I ordered an extra pair for reserve. But so far this first pair has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: product cracks the lense
customer_reviews.text: I destoyed two perscription pair of glasses with this product. The clips are too tight and cracked the eye glass in one of the lenses. I thought it was a fluke the first time. Use on a second pair and that second pair was cracked in one lense by the end of two weeks. I have never broken a lense in over twenty years of use, so I cannot believe that it was any abuse on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Billw1119

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Temporary Use I Have
customer_reviews.text: Recently had eye surgery and my prescription sunglasses were not working for me at all well. These plus a pair of 'computer' glasses make a better fit until I can get the prescription version again. The local stores had clip-on with the clips at the side of the glasses and they don't fit my large lens at all. This clip-on doesn't cover my glasses vertically, but that is actually an advantage for driving. Also like the included card with a fisherman and a fish that can only be seen with polarized lens.
customer_reviews.author: ROY WINTERS

customer_reviews.title: awesome clip one!
customer_reviews.text: The glasses were so light weight but very sturdy and seemed to be made out of good quality material. The rubber covers seem to provide good protection for my new Prescription glasses I was afraid to scratch.Iam happy with my purchase, its was a very good deal it even came with a little bag to protect it from scratches but I want to buys hard protective case since the glasses look so delicate. I should mentioned though In bought a tablet that was shipped on stop of the glasses and they held up pretty well with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: gummybear26

customer_reviews.title: A Clip In Time
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually wear glasses. I wear contacts. But when my contacts got messed up, I needed clip on sunglasses for my real glasses, I went to Amazon and looked at all the different clip ons. Read the different ratings. Picked these. They were at my house in two days, right before a European vacation. They fit perfectly. I wore then all through Europe. I can't say that I was gentle at all. They have held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size/fit for Men's Rectabgular Glasses
customer_reviews.text: The clip-ons fit my new rectangular frames (men's) perfectly. The lenses are very light, polarized, a traditional green and very easy to clip on--off. They have rubber footings that clip on the eyeglass lens--no scratching. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Henk

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The packing is good, and the metal clipper is as expected. However, either it is not carefully manufactured, or the quality control is really bad. My piece turned out to be asymmetric The attachments of the left and right polarizer are not symmetric aligned which makes clipper poorly aligned when clipped on the optics. When flipping it up, the edge of one polarizer touches and scratches my frames. I couldn't have returned it since I have to use it for a road trip.
customer_reviews.author: Yuchen Zhou

customer_reviews.title: good but fit issue
customer_reviews.text: these are great clip ons however they did not work with my particular frame. The clip piece landed directly in the nose piece and was not adjustable as far as I could tell but I was able to see how well they filtered the sunlight and they would have done a fine job had they fit. also the clip at the top is annoying. I suppose I would have gotten used to it but when you first put them on its all you see
customer_reviews.author: David Dellman

customer_reviews.title: Blocks vision
customer_reviews.text: I do have a pair of prescription sunglasses but wanted a backup for my regular glasses, since I am consistently going in and out of buildings for my job(I work at a water park). My problem with these are they kind of block my vision where the clip sits on my glasses, it's all I notice and feel like it blurs my vision.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT BE RETURNED!!
customer_reviews.text: An Amazon Prime item that can't be returned? Why am I spending $100/year for Prime, then? This is exactly the type of product that needs to be tried on before the purchaser can be sure it'll fit on the glasses. Nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyFour

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Durable, and makes driving safer
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for at least 6 months now and they are great. Clip on mechanism is easy to use, doesn't damage glasses, and doesn't fall off. It's been very reliable and durable as I use it almost everyday. The glasses part are dark enough to block out a lot of the sun or the sun's reflections off of people's cars (which can be super annoying) but not so dark that you can't safely see the road. Makes driving easier and much safer.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and plenty dark enough
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting much in quality at this price, and it did not seem like they would be dark enough based on the pictures. I was wrong on both points, this product is excellent and would recommend to anyone considering a pair.
customer_reviews.author: sturdy55

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected
customer_reviews.text: The review is asking me questions as if this item (clip on sunglasses) was a pair of shoes...funny. The clips work well, the lenses are plenty dark and polarized; they do not completely cover the lenses on my prescription driving glasses, but that is no big deal. I just started wearing glasses again, and bought these clips to avoid having to buy prescription sunglasses...for that they work fine and are a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Beal

customer_reviews.title: Too much distortion
customer_reviews.text: The curvature of the lens creates too much distortion when polarization is necessary. Tried using these for fishing but the usable field of vision was incredibly small. You get what you pay for for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AvgReviewer

customer_reviews.title: A cut above normal cheap clip-ons.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice clip-ons. The plastic is thick and the rivets holding the lenses to the frame are large and strong. Optically perfect. I ordered a blue and bronze shade and prefer the bronze, but the blue is fine. These clip-ons are a step above the normal drugstore polarized clip-ons.
customer_reviews.author: 90Below

customer_reviews.title: Very inexpensive and does the job. Most you will get for this price.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Fits a bit closer to my glasses than other's I have tried, having less reflection when in bright sunlight. But there is some, as there is always with flip-up's Wear a billed hat and it eliminates that. Minor obstruction from the clips AT this price you can't go wrong. Green color is more effective than I thought and I like it better than the black lenses.
customer_reviews.author: SIerra Gray

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are great and don't look like total old guy glasses. (Sorry, old guys.) I keep them in the tackle box. They are sturdy and work well. The clip is a little wide, so it clips more on the lenses than the bridge, but for the quality and price, it isn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: But they turned out to be a perfect fit, so I'm over the moon about that
customer_reviews.text: Took a shot on these not knowing how (or even if) the would fit my prescription eyeglasses. But they turned out to be a perfect fit, so I'm over the moon about that. Time will tell how durable they'll be, but so far, so good. They feel well-made. One concern I have is whether or not they'll scratch easily. If they do, I'll be back to revise my review. But for now, these are looking like a win.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Cuda

customer_reviews.title: Don't go blind. Ignore the gigantic clip in the middle.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific so far. Gets docked a star because of the big, honking clip that sits at your forehead. I knew it was there before I bought it, but it's kind of like the mole on Fred Savage's face in Gold Member, I can't stop looking at it. But I didn't get these glasses to pick up the ladies, I got them so I wouldn't go blind from the sun. And they seem to be working.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I love em
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from extreme light sensitivity, and these shades are absolutely life-saving. I look like a dork when they're flipped up but the absence of intense pain under direct light is worth it, as well as looking actually nice when they're flipped down.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: They are heavy compared to normal glasses
customer_reviews.text: Average clip on sunglasses, they weigh too much and pull the normal glasses down you’re nose. They are quite awkward to use, not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: They fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I've worn glasses for years and couldn't put shades on them until now. They fit like a glove.... I absolutely love them....That's coming from a Florida boy. Come out with a magnet fit and they would even be better..
customer_reviews.author: bothedrummer

customer_reviews.title: Bulky clip and cheap quality for lens
customer_reviews.text: It is not fitting my glasses well, plus I hate the BIG clip which comes right in between the eyebrows and it's just bulky. Now I don't like this product, I can't return it since it's a policy of the seller to not accept returns. I wish I could return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Clear, anti-glare, significantly reduce eye strain in front of computer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Fam J

customer_reviews.title: But nice to be able to come in from outside
customer_reviews.text: They work fairly well, because of the plastic material used, one is never sure about scratch resistance, so I plan on being very careful when cleaning. As with any internet order, the size/fit is always an issue, but these do come close to fitting most of my eye glass lens area. But nice to be able to come in from outside, and just flip up the sun glass portions, and not have to change glasses, or wait for transition lenses to change back to clear.
customer_reviews.author: James V.

customer_reviews.title: They help make my glasses more versatile!
customer_reviews.text: The clip on sunglasses are very easy to use and they were quite well. I need a very strong glasses for when I’m driving and so I can’t wear the corner of Kirby glasses. And since I spend a lot of money on my classes to begin with I think at the clip bonds would help make the classes that I have more versatile. Thank you very much
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems
customer_reviews.text: Lost one of the cap things that protects your lens from being scratched from the metal clamp on the first day. Also there is a glare that makes it impossible to see. These sunglasses did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to clip on
customer_reviews.text: They are okay. They are not as easy to clip on as others I've had. They also slide around on my glasses. I can't just clip then on and expect them to look right... they need major adjustments each time.
customer_reviews.author: CBCalvert

customer_reviews.title: There must be some better in market
customer_reviews.text: Rinky dink center clip is a bear to open and insert over glasses. vey frustrating. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bobst

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for driving sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of these sunglasses and all are effective sun protection
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B

customer_reviews.title: Best clip-on sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Best polarising clip-on sunglasses, looking nicer than similar clip-ons thanks to smaller clip. A must-have for all drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Handydoc

customer_reviews.title: Great Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. He loves them. Especially the fact that they don't go all the way to the bottom of his glasses. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Today's Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Whoever invented these clip-ons should be awarded the "eyeglass invention of the year." I have several pairs in each of my cars and I use them constantly. Way better than the products with magnets.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Woodward (Texas)

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, don't cover my glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, cheap, do not cover the lens of my glasses. These clip-ons are very narrow -- they cover the top 2/3 of my glasses, leave the bottom 1/3 of the lens uncovered. These are made of flimsy, thin plastic. The clip seems to be sturdy enough but I'm sending these back.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner Truth

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The clip is heavy however my husband looks like a cool dude
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: The price for the performance they provide: that's the best way to describe value and these lenses do it well!
customer_reviews.author: Saluda Claude

customer_reviews.title: junk. The film peels off
customer_reviews.text: They look great and are light weight but very poor quality. The mirrored film peeled off in less than 2 weeks. I only use a damp tissue to clean them. This is the second pair I tried and the same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: You don't see blue -- you see brown!
customer_reviews.text: How can blue sunglasses make everything look brown? I want BLUE!
customer_reviews.author: Tom D. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for regular glasses
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Perfect size for my new glasses so that I can wear them outside. Have not used them for long as yet but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: English woman

customer_reviews.title: Can't Recommend This Product
customer_reviews.text: The clips on the inside of the glass are in my field of vision and give me a headache. I severely wanted to enjoy this product to help me read in sunlight, but I cannot recommend this product. Quality is okay, clip works as advertised. Flips up fine. IF you can get over the clips in your field of view, you might do okay with this product, but for myself, again, I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shark Likes

customer_reviews.title: Prescription Frames? These are a must!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted sunglasses, but I can't wear those with my prescription glasses on. These offer the same protection as sunglasses, and easily attach to my regular frames. Thank you, Besgoods! 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J. Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Usable in a pinch or if you have nothing else ...
customer_reviews.text: Usable in a pinch or if you have nothing else, but they are made to be generic and fit as many frames as possible. These got me through a couple of weeks after my prescription sunglasses broke.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Buy you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of replacing my Walmart. Sunglasses so I got these they've been working for the last year
customer_reviews.author: Hear

customer_reviews.title: when you flip them up they stay there
customer_reviews.text: they are grate fore when you are driving a car you can flip them up to see the interments on the dash
customer_reviews.author: john b. storm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. They clip onto the top
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. They clip onto the top. The make things look great is brilliant sunshine. Watch out for the clip ons that attach on the sides of the glasses. They have distorted the glasses and need realignment, which i hope is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: Extra Durable
customer_reviews.text: More rugged and durable than brands found at local retailers. Been using these types of sunglasses for 30+ yrs. These are the best ever found.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous3141

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: The clips are sometimes a bit annoying as you can see them in your vision. Most of the time they are not noticeable. Also when the sun is at a low angle from the side there is some amount of glare. But the alternative, buying prescription sunglasses, costs several hundred dollars. So as I said good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Better built than a name brand I own
customer_reviews.text: The clip on this product is a much better grade than the brand I bought from my local grocery store last year (sold at Walgreens and Jewel). Although the measurements are slightly of these do fit my glasses (ex. 37mm height instead of the 36mm listed in the product description)
customer_reviews.author: S. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: bumps into my prominent brow, can't use
customer_reviews.text: I can't use them because they bump into the ridge between my eyebrows and this is more uncomfortable than the sun shining in my eyes. I have a prominent brow ridge. If yours is prominent, you might want to consider the clip-ons that clip to the sides of your frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jay tee 28

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and does what it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit hesitant for the price but was wrong. Works good, great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Bill d
